main event: On 22 August 1956, a civilian observed two round white objects near the sun and took several photographs.
interesting points: The objects were first photographed with a Polaroid camera, using multiple filters, The sighting lasted approximately 40 minutes, The objects were reported as stationary, The images taken showed the objects altering position between shots, The base's initial evaluation suggested the objects were likely due to lens refraction.
witness description: A civilian observer who reported seeing white round objects near the sun.
